result.execSummary:
The defendant Isaiah M. Nieves was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Isaiah M. Nieves is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Isaiah M. Nieves was found guilty of Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Submit to an AODA assessment and comply with any and all recommendations per probation
Obtain high school diploma or equivalent

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Isaiah M. Nieves

records.addlTxt: Notice of right to seek postconviction relief

10:02 AM DA calls case and states appearances Defendant Isaiah M. Nieves in court.  Attorney Joseph L Bauer in court for Isaiah M. Nieves.  Attorney Karl J. Kelz in court for State of Wisconsin. DA Kelz states an agreement has been reached and recites the agreement on record. DA Kelz states Victim Right's Legislation has been complied with. Contingent upon the defendant's plea to Ct. 1 in 22CF10, Ct. 1 in 22CM04, and Ct. 1 in 22CM16 the State will move to Dismiss Ct. 2 in case 22CM16. DE enters plea of NO CONTEST to Ct. 1 in 22CF10, Ct. 1 in 22CM04, and Ct. 1 in 22CM16 therefore Ct. 2 in case 22CM16 is DISMISSED. Court questions DE regarding the plea. DA explains elements of charge.  Court finds plea/waiver to be free, etc.  Court finds factual basis does exist.  Court accepts plea, finds DE guilty and orders entry of JOC in cases: 22CM04 and 22CM1 and entry of DEJ in case 22CF10. Comments by parties. 

22CF10:
Ct .1 - DEJ for 18 months 

22CM04:
Ct. 1- Withheld Sentence 
1 Year Probation 
Conditions of Probation:
$243 Court costs 
$200 DNA + Sample 
AODA Assessment 
$65 Service by DA fees 

22CM16:
Ct. 1- Withheld Sentence 
1 Year Probation 
Conditions of Probation:
$243 Court costs 
$200 DNA + Sample 
AODA Assessment 
$45 Service by DA fees 

Ct. 2- DISMISSED 


Defendant is given 0 days jail credit. 


Appeal Rights Given
Motion hearing on September 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.

11:00 AM DA calls cases 22CF10,22CM04,22CM16 and states appearances. Prosecuting attorney Karl J. Kelz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Isaiah M. Nieves in court.  Attorney Joseph L Bauer in court for Isaiah M. Nieves. DA Kelz moves to adjourn the motion hearing in case 22CM04. So ordered. In case 22CM16 Attorney Bauer gives status. In case 22CF10 Attorney Bauer states his client will waive his preliminary hearing. Attorney Bauer presents the court with a copy of the Preliminary hearing waiver signed by himself and his client. Court goes over the form with the defendant line item by line item. Preliminary Hearing waived.  Waiver accepted by the Court. Court finds probable cause exists that a crime was committed and binds DE over for trial. Information filed, acknowledged by parties and reading waived. DE enters plea of NOT GUILTY to all counts. Motion hearings in cases: 22CM04 and 22CM16 to be rescheduled for 09/15/2022 at 10:00 AM
Status hearing on June 7, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status hearing on May 25, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
If not already completed DE must submit to booking at Sheriff's Dept prior to release.
Defendant shall give written notice prior to any change in address or telephone number to the Clerk of this Court and Defense Attorney.

09:59 AM Defendant Isaiah M. Nieves appeared with attorney Joseph L Bauer.  Karl J. Kelz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint acknowledged, reading waived.  DE enters plea of NOT GUILTY to all counts. DA Kelz makes bond recommendations. Bond ordered as requested.  Court orders Pre-trial conference be scheduled.
